## Cost of Equity Capital

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
mrp <- rnorm(1, mean = 8, sd = 0.01)
rf <- rnorm(1, mean = 5, sd = 0.01)
beta <- rnorm(1, mean = 1, sd = 0.2)
em <- mrp + rf
mrp2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 8, sd = 0.01)
rf2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 5, sd = 0.01)
beta2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 1, sd = 0.2)
em2 <- mrp + rf
```


::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkNumericAnswer('module4_num_q1b')" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q1b"><strong>Suppose a security's beta is `r round(beta2,2)`. If the risk-free rate is `r round(rf2,2)`% and the expected market return is `r round(em2,2)`%, what is the security's cost of equity capital?</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q1b" name="module4_num_q1b" placeholder="Enter value" style="width: 150px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r round(rf2 + beta2 * (em2 - rf2),3)` data-tolerance="0.01" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q1b" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Cost of Equity = r_f + β × (E[R_M] - r_f) = **`r round(rf2 + beta2 * (em2 - rf2),2)`**%.
</div>

:::
